graph

Interface Graph


  • public interface Graph
    Basic interface for creating a graph, directed or not.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Vertex addValue(java.lang.Object value)
      Adds a value into the graph by creating a new vertex which is returned by the method.
      void addVertex(Vertex vertex)
      Adds the vertex given in parameter to the graph.
      void addVertices(Vertex[] vertices)
      Adds vertices given in the array to the graph.
      Edge connect(Vertex beginning, Vertex end)
      Connect two vertex that are already into the graph and returns the edge created between them.
      boolean contains(java.lang.Object value)
      Tells if the value is contained in at least one vertex in the graph.
      boolean contains(Vertex vertex)
      Tells if the given vertex is in the graph.
      void disconnect(Edge edge)
      Remove the given edge from the graph.
      void disconnect(Vertex vertex)
      Disconnect all edges attached to the given vertex.
      void disconnect(Vertex beginning, Vertex end)
      Disconnect the two vertices given in parameter.
      Vertex[] getNeighbours(Vertex vertex)
      Returns an array containing all the neighbours of the given vertex.
      boolean isDirected()
      Tells if the graph is directed or not.
      void removeVertex(Vertex vertex)
      Removes the given vertex from the graph and all the edge attached to it.
      void removeVertices(Vertex[] vertices)
      Removes the vertices given in the array from the graph.

    • Method Detail

      • isDirected

        boolean isDirected()
        Tells if the graph is directed or not.
        Returns:
        True if the graph is directed, false otherwise.

      • addVertex

        void addVertex(Vertex vertex)
        Adds the vertex given in parameter to the graph.
        Parameters:
        vertex - The vertex to add into the graph.

      • addVertices

        void addVertices(Vertex[] vertices)
        Adds vertices given in the array to the graph.
        Parameters:
        vertices - The array containing the vertices to add.

      • removeVertex

        void removeVertex(Vertex vertex)
        Removes the given vertex from the graph and all the edge attached to it.
        Parameters:
        vertex - The vertex to emove from the graph.

      • removeVertices

        void removeVertices(Vertex[] vertices)
        Removes the vertices given in the array from the graph.
        Parameters:
        vertices - The array containing the vertices to remove from the graph.

      • addValue

        Vertex addValue(java.lang.Object value)
        Adds a value into the graph by creating a new vertex which is returned by the method.
        Parameters:
        value - Value to add into the graph.
        Returns:
        Vertex containing the value passed in paramter after adding it to the graph.

      • connect

        Edge connect(Vertex beginning,
             Vertex end)
        Connect two vertex that are already into the graph and returns the edge created between them.
        Parameters:
        beginning - The beginning o the edge.
        end - The end of the edge.

      • disconnect

        void disconnect(Vertex vertex)
        Disconnect all edges attached to the given vertex.

      • disconnect

        void disconnect(Vertex beginning,
                Vertex end)
        Disconnect the two vertices given in parameter. Equivalent to remove all the edges between them.

      • disconnect

        void disconnect(Edge edge)
        Remove the given edge from the graph.

      • getNeighbours

        Vertex[] getNeighbours(Vertex vertex)
        Returns an array containing all the neighbours of the given vertex.

      • contains

        boolean contains(java.lang.Object value)
        Tells if the value is contained in at least one vertex in the graph.

      • contains

        boolean contains(Vertex vertex)
        Tells if the given vertex is in the graph.
